page.title: 01Coniston in Holderness
page.content:
Coniston 1086 Domesday Coningesbi. Population (1983) 270. Situated six miles west of Hull on the main A165 Hull to Bridlington road.
A typical east riding rural village in a low-lying landscape on the eastern edge of the Hull valley with scattered farms in the midst of large open fields typical of the plain of Holderness. Although situated in a 'Green Belt' area there is a sloww but steady infill of commuters from Hull. There are two agricultural machinery firms, a repairs/servicing garage, a post office/general store, public house, church and village hall.
